meanings.definition: A unit of flow rate equal to one cubic foot per second.
meanings.sent1: The irrigation canal can handle up to ten cusecs of water per second.
meanings.sent2: The river was flowing at a rate of five cusecs per second.
meanings.sent3: The farmer accidentally ordered a truckload of cusecs instead of cubic feet for irrigation.
meanings.sent4: The cusecs of information flowing through the internet can be overwhelming.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the waterfall was like a thousand cusecs crashing down.

meanings.definition: A measurement used to quantify the flow of water in irrigation canals.
meanings.sent1: The engineer calculated the cusecs of water needed for the rice fields.
meanings.sent2: The farmers monitored the cusecs to ensure proper irrigation.
meanings.sent3: The ducks were confused by the concept of cusecs in the canal.
meanings.sent4: The cusecs of water flowing sounded like a symphony to the farmers.
meanings.sent5: The measurement of cusecs helped optimize the irrigation system.
